data:
Sure, I can help you with that! Here are the four stakeholder groups of PREVENT-IA, listed in order of involvement:

1. Core Team:
	* Product Manager
	* Developers
	* UX Designers
	* AI Engineers
	* Technical Writers
	* Data Scientists
	* Business Analysts
	* Quality Assurance Engineers
	* DevOps Engineers
	* Project Managers
	These stakeholders are directly involved in the development, design, and management of PREVENT-IA. They are responsible for ensuring that the product meets the objectives, goals, and requirements of the business and its users.
2. Frequent Involvement Stakeholders:
	* Sales and Marketing Teams
	* HR and Training Managers
	* Compliance and Regulatory Officers
	* Subject Matter Experts (SMEs)
	* Legal and Policy Experts
	* Customer Support Teams
	These stakeholders are involved in the promotion, sales, and support of PREVENT-IA. They are responsible for ensuring that the product is aligned with the needs and expectations of the market, the users, and the regulatory framework.
3. Occasional Involvement Stakeholders:
	* Executives and C-levels
	* Investors and Shareholders
	* Industry Associations and Partners
	* Academic and Research Institutions
	* Government Agencies and Authorities
	These stakeholders are involved in the strategic direction, funding, and oversight of PREVENT-IA. They are responsible for ensuring that the product contributes to the mission, vision, and values of the organization, and that it complies with the legal and ethical standards of the industry.
4. Seldom Involvement Stakeholders:
	* End-users and Customers
	* Competitors and Alternatives
	* General Public and Media
	* Advocacy and Interest Groups
	These stakeholders are involved in the adoption, evaluation, and feedback of PREVENT-IA. They are responsible for ensuring that the product meets the needs and preferences of the users, and that it addresses the concerns and expectations of the society.

Here is a table listing the stakeholders in order of involvement and explaining their implication:

| Stakeholder Group | Stakeholders | Implication |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Core Team | Product Manager, Developers, UX Designers, AI Engineers, Technical Writers, Data Scientists, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Engineers, DevOps Engineers, Project Managers | Directly involved in the development, design, and management of PREVENT-IA. Responsible for ensuring that the product meets the objectives, goals, and requirements of the business and its users. |
| Frequent Involvement Stakeholders | Sales and Marketing Teams, HR and Training Managers, Compliance and Regulatory Officers, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), Legal and Policy Experts, Customer Support Teams | Involved in the promotion, sales, and support of PREVENT-IA. Responsible for ensuring that the product is aligned with the needs and expectations of the market, the users, and the regulatory framework. |
| Occasional Involvement Stakeholders | Executives and C-levels, Investors and Shareholders, Industry Associations and Partners, Academic and Research Institutions, Government Agencies and Authorities | Involved in the strategic direction, funding, and oversight of PREVENT-IA. Responsible for ensuring that the product contributes to the mission, vision, and values of the organization, and that it complies with the legal and ethical standards of the industry. |
| Seldom Involvement Stakeholders | End-users and Customers, Competitors and Alternatives, General Public and Media, Advocacy and Interest Groups | Involved in the adoption, evaluation, and feedback of PREVENT-IA. Responsible for ensuring that the product meets the needs and preferences of the users, and that it addresses the concerns and expectations of the society. |
